intro: Antidesma cubanum var. pallidum, commonly known as the pale antidesma, is a shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba and parts of the Bahamas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites.
